Who We Are

We are not a large institution. We are moms, neighbors, and community members who refused to look away when crisis arrived at our doorstep.

Get in Touch

Our Story

In early November 2023, as thousands of immigrants arrived in Denver seeking safety, a grassroots movement was born. What started with a few compassionate neighbors has grown into a powerful network of humanity.

We saw families sleeping in tents in freezing temperatures and knew we had to act. Within just 12 weeks, we grew from a handful of volunteers to over 6,000 community members united by a single purpose: to provide dignity and stability to those transitioning from crisis to hope.

Our Mission

"To provide humanitarian aid and support to immigrants and asylum seekers, fostering a community where everyone has the opportunity to thrive."

How We Help

Crisis to HOPE Fund

Immediate financial assistance for essentials, helping families bridge the gap between survival and stability.

Pathways to HOPE

Pro se asylum application support and legal clinics to ensure everyone has a fair chance at safety.

Host Home Program

Connecting community hosts with families for up to 90 days of transitional housing and cultural exchange.

Community Services

Workforce readiness, community service partnerships, and fostering local integration.

Proudly Partnering With

WeeCycle The Jeffco Action Center I Support the Girls Mile High United Way

A 501(c)(3) non-profit organization dedicated to providing humanitarian aid, housing, and legal support to asylum seekers in Denver.
